Sentencas: Sr-2(MgMo)(2)O6-delta and materials of nominal compositions with increased and decreased Mo content were synthesized and their stability and catalytic activity towards CH4 oxidation characterized under solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anode conditions.
Titulo: On the methane oxidation activity of Sr2(MgMo)2O6-δ: a potential anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Sr-2(MgMo)(2)O6-delta was synthesized as a double perovskite.
Titulo: On the methane oxidation activity of Sr2(MgMo)2O6-δ: a potential anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Materials with increased Mo content formed a mixture of the double perovskite Sr2MgMoO6-delta and the single perovskite SrMoO3, after synthesis in H-2, with the amount of SrMoO3 increasing with increasing Mo content.
Titulo: On the methane oxidation activity of Sr2(MgMo)2O6-δ: a potential anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: SrMoO3 is unstable in air and slowly oxidized to the scheelite-structured impurity SrMoO4.
Titulo: On the methane oxidation activity of Sr2(MgMo)2O6-δ: a potential anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: All compositions decomposed to Mo, MgO and SrO in dry 20% CH4/N-2 at temperatures >= 850 degrees C. CH4 reaction rates were catalytically limited with measured rates significantly lower than for La0.75Sr0.25Cr0.5Mn0.5O3-delta.
Titulo: On the methane oxidation activity of Sr2(MgMo)2O6-δ: a potential anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Rates increased by 1-2 orders of magnitude when 2 wt-% of Pt was added to the surface.
Titulo: On the methane oxidation activity of Sr2(MgMo)2O6-δ: a potential anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells
